project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an Estimate has a long value, when splitting the issue, the value would not be displayed incompletely. Due to the long value, it appears to be truncated. Replicable in all Browsers.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue in Scrum Board
# Access the Backlog, assign a long valued Estimate to the issue (e.g.: 12345)
# Split the issue (right-click on the issue)
# The problem appears

h3. Expected Results
The Estimate value would show completely

h3. Actual Results
The Estimate value would show incompletely

*Jira 7.6.16:*
 !SplitIssue.png|thumbnail! 

*Jira 8.4.0:*
 !SplitIssue2.png|thumbnail! 
Slightly better but still incomplete, especially if the value is more than 5 digits

h3. Workaround
Click on the Estimate value and press the 'Right-arrow' key to scroll to the right of the value
fields.summary: Estimate field when splitting issue would not display incompletely for long values

h3. Issue Summary

If you access the Screens tab in the Portuguese translation of Jira, there are a couple of strings that have not been translated. I have raised a request with the team responsible and I have received the following response from one of their members.

{quote}
As I'm not able to find these string(s) in my Strings file for Jira Server, I believe this is a product bug. Could you please raise a bug ticket with the Jira Server team? 
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Here are the steps to access the tab mentioned:

{panel}
# Click on the *Jira Administration Icons* > *Projects*.
# Select a project.
# Click on *Screens* at the sidebar.
{panel}

Also here are the steps to access the tab in Portuguese:

{panel}
# Click on the *Ícone de Administração do Jira* > *Projetos*.
# Select a project.
# Click on *Telas* at the sidebar.
{panel}

All the information should be translated into Portuguese.

A few strings are not translated. 

!Screen Shot 2019-10-26 at 20.44.45.png|thumbnail!

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Webhooks creating from the Jira integration with GitHub Enterprise are created with an incorrect URL.

Previously, Push and Pull webhooks were created using the same URL
 * Push: JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/XXXXXXX/sync
 * Pull request: JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/XXXXXXX/sync

But in 7.13.8 and 8.5.x, the push webhook is being created as an incorrect payload JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/XXXXXXX/repo/sync resulting in Invalid HTTP response: 415.
h3. IMPACT ON YOUR INSTANCE

This bug specifically affects webhook operation (eg. smart commit). DVCS can fallback to the hourly sync to fetch changes from GH/E. However, it means changes can delay up to 1 hour before they got across in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 7.13.8
 # Connect Jira to Github Enterprise

h3. Expected Results

Webhook created with the correct payload URL
{code:java}
<BASE_URL>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/<repository-id>/sync 
{code}
h3. Actual Results
Webhook created with incorrect payload URL resulting in 415
{code:java}
<BASE_URL>/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/<repository-id>/repo/sync 
{code}
!wb.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This issue affects Jira version released after July 2019
h3. Workaround

Remove "/repo" from the payload URL manually, webhook work properly, or by [rest API|https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#update-a-repository-webhook] directly to Github:
 # Grab all webhooks from each repo: 
{code:java}
curl --location --request GET 'https://api.github.com/repos/<user>/<repo name>/hooks' \
--header 'Authorization: Basic xxxxxxxxx' \
{code}
This will return the following, we are looking for any webhook IDs that have the offending url pattern (/repo) in this case it would be "id": 252018187:
{code:java}
 {
        "type": "Repository",
        "id": 252018187,
        "name": "web",
        "active": true,
        "events": [
            "push"
        ],
        "config": {
            "content_type": "form",
            "insecure_ssl": "0",
            "url": "https://BASEURL/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/1/repo/sync"
        },
        "updated_at": "2020-09-28T18:48:55Z",
        "created_at": "2020-09-28T18:46:41Z",
        "url": "https://api.github.com/repos/volktronz/TEST/hooks/252018187",
        "test_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/volktronz/TEST/hooks/252018187/test",
        "ping_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/volktronz/TEST/hooks/252018187/pings",
        "last_response": {
            "code": 200,
            "status": "active",
            "message": "OK"
        }
    }
{code}
 # Then we'd make another call to each webhook ID identified with the right URL pattern:
{code:java}
curl --location --request PATCH 'https://api.github.com/repos/volktronz/test/hooks/252018187' \
--header 'Authorization: Basic xxxxxxxx' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw ' { "config": {
       "url": "https:BASEURL/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/1/sync"
        }
 } 
 '{code}
fields.summary: DVCS create incorrect webhook payload URL resulting 415 error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When moving an issue from issue types with two quickfilters selected from inside a rapidboard, an error 500 is displayed.

h3. Environment

 * Jira Software higher than 8.4.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to a RapidBoard and create a new issue
 # select two quickfilters
 # try moving the issue to another issue type
 # an error 500 is presented

h3. Expected Results

The issue is moved properly.

h3. Actual Results

The error 500 happens because the quickFilter get parameters is encoded with HTML characters as the quickfilters IDs are added separated by a comma:

 * <base-url>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=detail&selectedIssue=TRB-5&quickFilter=*3%2C4&quickFilter=3%2C4*

For example, *3%2C4* is basically *3,4*, which is the IDs of each quickfilter. Therefore, the URL should be:

 * <base-url>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=detail&selectedIssue=TRB-5&quickFilter=*3&quickFilter=4*

That said, Jira throws a NumberFormatException as that input format separated by a comma is not expected.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving an issue from a RapidBoard with quickfilters selected, results in an error 500

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring nested conditions in a workflow, the connectors "All" and "Any" are not behaving as expected after updating the conditions. Basically, "Any" gets ignored and replaced automatically by "All".

Let's take an example of conditions Con:
 Con = All (Any(A,B), C)
 If you remove C, then Con becomes All(A,B), when it should be Any(A,B). 
h3. Environment
 * Jira 8.4.1
 * also seen in Jira 8.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a clean Jira 8.4.1 with atlas-run.
 # Open the "classic default workflow" for edit (or any other workflow).
 # In transition "Start Progress", configure the conditions as shown in screenshot 1.
 # Delete condition marked with (1)

h3.   !1.png|width=240,height=147!      !2.png|width=309,height=138!
h3. Expected Results

The final condition should be "Any" of the two remaining conditions.
h3. Actual Results

The inner condition "Any" switched to "All" (screenshot 2).

 
h3. Workaround

Simply fix the connectors manually.
fields.summary: Workflow nested conditions' connectors not behaving as expected

fields.description:
Back in 2012, this did work, see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6109

Since the migration to JIRA 7's licensing it's now necessary to have a 'JIRA Software' license in order to access JIRA Boards. As a result, anonymous users cannot view Boards any longer. Have a read of [https://confluence.atlassian.com/migration/jira-7/cloud_jira+agile_product-changes] for more details on the change, specifically, there's a table further down that describes the differences between each license/role.

This change breaks our communication strategy 
The Kanban Board used is one of our main 'at a glance' communication tools towards our main stakeholders and vital in keeping them engaged in the development progress.
fields.summary: show board to Anonymous users

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user clicks on something in the Dev Panel, if the user has permission/is able to authenticate, they are forwarded to the Dev application where they may view the review, commit, pull request, etc. external to JIRA. If the user is not authorized to view the resource, they receive a very nondescript error message which simply states
{quote}You don't have access to view all related reviews. Please contact you administrator.
{quote}
This leads to end users frequently reaching out to the Administrators for help with permissions. Less experienced or technical users may not be able to accurately identify which resource they are trying to access.

Screenshot of error message attached.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be ideal for the Administrators if the user was provided with a link or easily identifiable description of the resource they are trying to access (in the error message directly) which they can share with the Admin. This will allow the Admin to more quickly determine if the user should be permissioned to view this resource, and grant or deny access accordingly.
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: As an end user, when clicking on a link in the Dev Panel, I want to see which resource I require access/permission for if I receive an error message.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira will schedule Lexorank rebalancing in 12 hours since the longest rank on the instance reaches 50 characters and will perform an immediate rebalance once the longest rank reaches 100 characters.
Those values might not be ideal, the threshold of 50 characters (out of the 250+ allowed) could be low in many cases. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Giving administrators an ability to configure those values would help with reducing issues caused by often lexorank rebalancing.
fields.summary: Allows admins to configure Lexorank rebalancing triggers

Is this possible?
fields.summary: Coloured Swimlanes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Scenario - User A has "Edit All Comments" project permission, but does not have "Edit Own Comments".

If the administrator uses the permission helper to check if the user A can edit his own comments he/she will receive the message "User A does not have the 'Edit Own Comments' permission" leading to believe that this user cannot edit own comments when he/she actually can since it has "Edit All Comments" permission.

Basically, the "Edit All Comments" permission overrides the "Edit Own Comments" and this is not clear in the permission helper.
h3. Suggested Solution

Give a warning message telling that the user can edit own comments if it has "Edit All Comments" permission
fields.summary: Permission helper should display that "Edit All Comments" overrides "Edit Own Comments" permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Having more than 65,000 closed sprints breaks the JQL function closedSprints() with an com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseTooComplexSearchException
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # install Jira Software
 # create a Scrum Development Project 'Test'
 # create sample issues and 65,001 closed sprints
 # test the JQL "project = Test AND sprint in closedSprints()"

h3. Expected Results

issues are listed without errors
h3. Actual Results

JQL fails with error
{noformat}
 com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseTooComplexSearchException: A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {sprint in closedSprints()}
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Even if there is a sensible workaround as stated below, similar bugs like JSWSERVER-16401 were resolved with optimizations in the JQL function because using the workaround may impact the performance of the system.
h3. Workaround
 - delete closed sprints;
 You may consider deleting your older closed sprints to keep the number of closed sprints under 65,000. You may determine the oldest closed Sprints that are not needed anymore for reporting purposes, and remove them using the ["Delete Sprint" operation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/8.13.0/#agile/1.0/sprint-deleteSprint] (deleting closed sprints is possible after Jira version 7.9, ref. JSWSERVER-9220)
 -- checking the number of closed sprints
{code:sql}
SELECT count(*) FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "CLOSED" = true
{code}
 -- figuring out the oldest closed sprints
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "CLOSED" = true order by "END_DATE"
{code}

 - Increase the default limit of 65,000 
 This can be done by increasing the value for {{jira.search.maxclauses}} in [jira-config.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/edit-the-jira-config-properties-file-in-jira-server-317194938.html].
 (!) Setting the parameter too high may have a performance impact on the system, hence please take care to increase the limit gradually (for example, if we're at 65,000 closed sprints already and currently closing 10,000K sprints/year, setting the limit to 85,000 will give us enough room for a couple of years already.)
fields.summary: Having more than 65,000 closed sprints breaks the JQL function closedSprints()

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Problem
Jira automatically creates post-commit webhooks in Bitbucket Cloud when linking a repository via the DVCS connector.  These use a url similar to:
{code}
http://jira.example.com/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/5/sync
{code}
When Jira runs behind a firewall, and the base URL is inaccessible from Bitbucket Cloud, typically a reverse proxy at another URL (restricted to Bitbucket Cloud's IP addresses) that proxies sync requests to Jira can be configured, but linking repositories is a manual process:
1. Link repository in Jira
2. Manually change the two auto-created Bitbucket Cloud webhooks to use reverse proxy URL

*Suggestion*
* It would be great if DVCS integration configuration accepts an alternative reverse proxy or application URL that would be used for the post-commit hook, rather than defaulting to a base URL.  That way, instead of adding hooks for {code}http://jira.example.com/rest/bitbucket/1.0/repository/5/sync{code} it would add hooks for {code}http://alt-jira-proxy.example.com/rest/bitbucket/1.0./repository/5/sync{code}
Similar to how we have application URL as opposed to display URL for Application Links
fields.summary: Allow specifying proxy url for auto-linked Bitbucket Cloud post-commit hooks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Flagged* custom field is created after you first flag an issue in the Backlog. The field is not lock and allows editing. If you add a new context for the field with a new option, you won't be able to flag issues in any project associated with that new context. When attempting to do so, you'll receive a pop-up error in the UI to the effect of:
{code:java}
Invalid value '10100' passed for customfield 'Flagged'.{code}
There are no errors logged to atlassian-jira.log or Catalina.out
h3. Environment

Reproduced on Jira 7.6, 7.13, 8.4 on Linux.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Flag an issue on a backlog to create the *Flagged* custom field
 # Add a new context for the field, define an option and associate to a project:
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-10 at 12.07.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 # Attempt to flag an issue on the backlog of the associated context
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-10 at 11.56.55 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Issue should be flagged on the backlog.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is not flagged & UI error thrown.

h3. Notes
If this is expected behavior, the *Flagged* field should be locked to prevent editing of this nature.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to flag an issue if you apply a context to the Flagged custom field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is a feature request to update the [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/completing-a-sprint-938845450.html] documentation in order to clarify the behavior described in [JSWSERVER-20276 : Clarify that when completing a sprint, sending incomplete issues to the next sprint will still send issues to the backlog if they are not visible from the current board.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20276].
-----
h3. Problem Definition

When a user completes an active sprint, they have an option to send the incomplete issues within that sprint either to the backlog, or into another sprint.

However, if the active sprint is being closed from within a Board that does not have full visibility of *all* of the incomplete issues in the sprint (i.e. if the board uses a more restrictive filter than the [Origin Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/sprints-appearing-on-multiple-boards-in-jira-server-779159068.html] of the sprint), those not-visible incomplete issues will still be sent to the Backlog, even if the user chooses to send them to another sprint.

This is intentional - issues should not be affected when they aren't present on the Board being worked on. However, we cannot keep them in the active sprint either, since it's being closed. Therefore, they are sent to the backlog. 

However, this is not clarified either in documentation, nor is the user closing the sprint warned of these not-visible issues. 

(!) A consequence of this is that users may later find issues which are not complete, yet belonged to a sprint which has since been completed. It is not easy for users to understand why these issues aren't automatically in an ongoing sprint and are still sitting in the backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution

As this is an intentional, yet not documented or explained to users, we need to:
* Improve the existing documentation at [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/completing-a-sprint-938845450.html]
* Provide additional messaging during the *Complete Sprint* operation. This could include any of the following:
** Explaining how many issues are not visible in scope of the current Board
** A link to the Origin Board of the sprint (so that the user may close the sprint there instead)
** Clarify what will happen to the not-visible issues should the operation complete 

h3. Workaround 

Avoid closing a sprint from a board that isn't the Origin Board of the sprint.

Determine the Origin Board via the *Workaround* steps in [JSWSERVER-13265 : Provide UI method to identify origin board for a sprint.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13265?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Aworklog-tabpanel]
fields.summary: Update Documentation - Clarify that when completing a sprint, sending incomplete issues to the next sprint will still send issues to the backlog if they are not visible from the current board.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a user completes an active sprint, they have an option to send the incomplete issues within that sprint either to the backlog, or into another sprint.

However, if the active sprint is being closed from within a Board that does not have full visibility of *all* of the incomplete issues in the sprint (i.e. if the board uses a more restrictive filter than the [Origin Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/sprints-appearing-on-multiple-boards-in-jira-server-779159068.html] of the sprint), those not-visible incomplete issues will still be sent to the Backlog, even if the user chooses to send them to another sprint.

This is intentional - issues should not be affected when they aren't present on the Board being worked on. However, we cannot keep them in the active sprint either, since it's being closed. Therefore, they are sent to the backlog. 

However, this is not clarified either in documentation, nor is the user closing the sprint warned of these not-visible issues. 

(!) A consequence of this is that users may later find issues which are not complete, yet belonged to a sprint which has since been completed. It is not easy for users to understand why these issues aren't automatically in an ongoing sprint and are still sitting in the backlog.

h3. Suggested Solution

As this is an intentional, yet not documented or explained to users, we need to:
* Improve the existing documentation at [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/completing-a-sprint-938845450.html] 
** [JSWSERVER-20277 : Update Documentation - Clarify that when completing a sprint, sending incomplete issues to the next sprint will still send issues to the backlog if they are not visible from the current board.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20277]
* Provide additional messaging during the *Complete Sprint* operation. This could include any of the following:
** Explaining how many issues are not visible in scope of the current Board
** A link to the Origin Board of the sprint (so that the user may close the sprint there instead)
** Clarify what will happen to the not-visible issues should the operation complete 

h3. Workaround 

Avoid closing a sprint from a board that isn't the Origin Board of the sprint.

Determine the Origin Board via the *Workaround* steps in [JSWSERVER-13265 : Provide UI method to identify origin board for a sprint.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13265?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Aworklog-tabpanel]
fields.summary: Clarify that when completing a sprint, sending incomplete issues to the next sprint will still send issues to the backlog if they are not visible from the current board.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user writes JQL queries via Jira's Advanced Search, certain fields support autocompletion, which will suggest values as the user types.

As the user types, Jira will use a thread to perform a search against what they've typed and return possible results back to the user. In large or slow instances, and depending on the field being autocompleted, this functionality may not return quickly, and can take multiple seconds.

It is possible for the user to continue typing and end up making multiple autocompletion requests before the previous requests ever complete and return to the user. Jira will not cancel or otherwise terminate previously ongoing autocompletion threads in this case.

The instance may experience high CPU load and thread utilization if too many of these threads are working on these autocompletion tasks.

Example fields include, but aren't limited to:
* Epic Link
* Components

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This issue is best reproduced in environments with high concurrent user load and activity, as well as large datasets. Otherwise, the issue may be partially induced in a stock Jira instance per the following:
 # Create a new Software project.
 # Using the [Data Generator for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] (do not use in Production), create at least 100,000 Epics in this project.
 ** More will cause the issue to reproduce more severely, but will take more time to generate and index the issues.
 # Using the Issue Navigator, begin creating a new JQL query (i.e. "Epic Link" = )
 # Through multiple windows and perhaps through the help of other users, begin typing values into the Epic Link field. They do not have to be real values (i.e "Epic Link" = abcde..."). Avoid typing more quickly than 2-3 characters/second.

h3. Expected Results

When users stop typing, suggested results will be shown.
h3. Actual Results

Observe that CPU usage on the instance elevates, with the severity and duration depending on the frequency that new characters are being typed, and how many concurrent submissions are being made (i.e. other windows or users).

Thread Dumps taken during this time will show many threads consuming CPU with stack traces containing (in the below example, for Epic Links):
{code:java}
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findImpl(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:183)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.find(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issuelink.EpicPickerServiceImpl.listEpicNames(EpicPickerServiceImpl.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.epiclink.EpicLinkClauseValueGenerator.getPossibleValues(EpicLinkClauseValueGenerator.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.internal.jql.FieldAndPredicateAutoCompleteResultGenerator.generateResults(FieldAndPredicateAutoCompleteResultGenerator.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.internal.jql.FieldAndPredicateAutoCompleteResultGenerator.getAutoCompleteResultsForField(FieldAndPredicateAutoCompleteResultGenerator.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.search.SearchAutoCompleteResource.getFieldAutoCompleteForQueryString(SearchAutoCompleteResource.java:136)
...
{code}

The following HTTP requests can be seen made against the Access Logs, showing an individual GET request per character typed:
{code}GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=c&_=1571178278998
GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=ci&_=1571178279798
GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=ciw&_=1571178280504
GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=ciwo&_=1571178281180
GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=ciwor&_=1571178281744
GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=ciworh&_=1571178282340
GET /node0/rest/api/2/jql/autocompletedata/suggestions?fieldName=component&fieldValue=ciworhe&_=1571178282909{code}

h3. Workaround

Avoid creating or editing multiple JQL queries at the same time, or in rapid succession.

Disable *JQL Auto-complete* per *Administration >> System >> General Configuration*

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow administrators to configure the frequency at which the browser may submit search requests.
fields.summary: JQL autocomplete suggestions on Epic field may cause performance issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Per [JSWSERVER-8665 : Autocomplete for Epic Link in JQL|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8665], Auto-completing functionality for the "Epic Link" field was introduced in Jira Agile 6.2.2, and this was formally written into the release notes for Jira Agile 6.3: [JIRA Agile 6.3 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-releases/jira-agile-release-notes/jira-agile-6-3-release-notes]

However, documentation for [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-fields-reference-939938743.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-epic_linkEpiclink] incorrectly states that Auto-complete is not possible with the Epic Link field. This can be seen as far back as 7.0 documentation through latest (8.4 at the time of writing).

Existing documentation as well as templates for future documentation releases need to be revised in order to clarify that Epic Link supports auto-completion.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Software documentation incorrectly states that Epic Link does not support auto-complete

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In JIRA 7.9.2, there is no collapsed view for issues in the board so after clicking on the "View on Board" link, the issue is displayed immediately on the board.

It turns out that In JIRA 8.3.2, issues in the board could be collapsed so clicking on "View on Board" link does not open the issue straight away if that issue is under the collapsed items.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a clean JIRA 8.3.2 instance;
# Create a JIRA Software Scrum project;
# Use [Data Generator for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] add-on to create 1K issues against the Scrum project.
# Go to the Scrum project board backlog and find the collapsed view
!Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 16.17.11.png|thumbnail! 
# Expand the collapsed view and take note of one issue key that is within the collapsed view;
# View the issue key using http://jira-server/browse/issue-key URL
# Click on the "View on board" link
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-07 at 16.20.20.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
* To get redirected to the issue on the board.

h3. Actual Results
* The board is opened without redirecting to the issue in question.

h3. Workaround
* Expand the collapsed view and use the browser search feature to locate the issue key on the board.
fields.summary: "View on board" hyperlink does not work for issues within the collapsed view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-17871].
  {panel}
h3. Problem Definition
When you are on an active sprint page of a board, and you need to remove an item from that sprint, you can right-click on the card and see an option to "Remove from Sprint".   The problem here is that the user doesn't have any clear choice about where to place that issue, such as into the backlog, or select a specific upcoming sprint instead.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the user was prompted to select an option such as
* Backlog
* future planed sprint #1
* future planed sprint #2


h3. Why this is important
Gives scrum masters / sprint admins much more control over where issues end up.  Also it would help with the consistency in Jira Software. For example, when closing a sprint, you are prompted where to place those incomplete issues, a feature implemented by JSWSERVER-6421

h3. Note
If no future sprints exist at the time this issue is to be removed from the board, then the board will place that issue in the backlog.  

h3. Workaround
You can choose which sprint to move the issue to by using the Backlog view instead.
fields.summary: When removing issue from an active sprint on board (active sprint page), prompt user where to place that issue, such as backlog or future sprint

When releasing a version with "-" name via:
{code}
VersionService.ReleaseVersionValidationResult result = versionService.validateReleaseVersion(user, version, releaseDate);Version releasedVersion = versionService.releaseVersion(result);
{code}

UI and JQL displays that the version is "UNRELEASED" but querying the database and looking into logs says that version is released:

Actual code:
{code}
VersionService.ReleaseVersionValidationResult result = versionService.validateReleaseVersion(user, version, releaseDate);logger.debug("Result IsValid {} for fix version {}", result.isValid(), version.getName());if (result.isValid()) {    logger.debug("Releasing fix version {}", version.getName());    Version releasedVersion = versionService.releaseVersion(result);    logger.debug("Fix version {} isReleased {} releaseDate {}", releasedVersion.getName(), releasedVersion.isReleased(), releasedVersion.getReleaseDate());} else {    logger.error("Can't update fix version {} {} {}", version.getName(), result.getErrorCollection().getErrors(), result.getErrorCollection().getErrorMessages());}

2019-08-13 12:36:01,973 http-nio-8080-exec-309 DEBUG jakubecz 756x7545878x1 vxjqs1 10.98.132.117,10.120.40.90 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [c.b.e.a.j.servicefirst.utils.IssueUtil] Releasing fix version apac-1565695797195.1565695797195
2019-08-13 12:36:01,984 http-nio-8080-exec-309 DEBUG jakubecz 756x7545878x1 vxjqs1 10.98.132.117,10.120.40.90 /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa [c.b.e.a.j.servicefirst.utils.IssueUtil] Fix version apac-1565695797195.1565695797195 isReleased true releaseDate 
2019-08-13 00:00:00.0
{code}

Actual DB results:
{code}
/****** Script for SelectTopNRows command from SSMS  ******/
SELECT TOP (1000) [ID]
      ,[PROJECT]
      ,[vname]
      ,[DESCRIPTION]
      ,[SEQUENCE]
      ,[RELEASED]
      ,[ARCHIVED]
      ,[URL]
      ,[RELEASEDATE]
      ,[STARTDATE]
  FROM [eqjira].[dbo].[projectversion]
  where vname = 'apac-1565695797195.1565695797195'

ID PROJECT vname DESCRIPTION SEQUENCE RELEASED ARCHIVED URL RELEASEDATE STARTDATE48336 20201 apac-1565695797195.1565695797195 Created by EqDevOps Bot from TeamCity build (id:1565695797195) 122 true NULL NULL 2019-08-13 00:00:00.000 NULL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create plugin app
# Try to release version using code earlier with version name: "apac-1565695797195.1565695797195"

More detailed information in: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-2995

JIRA GUI "Project settings" -> "Versions" must be always in "RELEASED" status

h3. Actual Results
JIRA GUI "Project settings" -> "Versions" is sometimes showing version as "UNRELEASED"

h3. Notes
* I talked to Jira team about this and it seems to be linked with how Lucene misenterpret part of a search string as an attribute "-" or overall version name is long
* Developer didn't try workaround to not use "-" as they need that in version name

User shorter version names or withouth "-"

h3. Issue Summary

When editing the Estimate field value on the "Issue Detail View", the mouse over that displays "Story Points" may block the checkmark created by the application to confirm the fields' new value. The only way that the user can insert the new value is by pressing the "Enter" key.

h3. Environment

 # Create a new Software Project.
 # Navigate to the "Issue Detail View" through the backlog (for example).
 # Click on the pencil icon to edit the *Estimate* value.

fields.description:
h4. Issue

Currently, we cannot connect to Oracle Autonomous Transaction Processing during Jira Installation because Jira offers no facility to edit the JDBC connect string to include the oracle wallet location during setup. This string is editable after installation in the dbconfig.xml file, but if a file is created, then the setup dialogue exits. 


h4. Summary

We need an ability to input raw connect string rather than just the host/port/service name of the current installation dialogue.

Client Connect to OCI: https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/atp-cloud/atpug/connect-preparing.html#GUID-3667EC68-930E-4566-95B3-DFA24203A8FF

Sample Connect String Requirement: <jdbc-datasource>
<url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@oacipoc_tp?TNS_ADMIN=/home/oracle/network/admin</url>

Reference: https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/atp-cloud/atpug/connect-jdbc-thin-wallet.html#GUID-1640CC02-BF3E-48C2-8FFE-A596614A6A40

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On 8.0+ versions, there is no way to have the Big Picture panel that is associated with an individual issue to remember its collapsed/expanded state.

Most custom fields and panels will remember when they are collapsed, and this memory span refreshes. However, the Big Picture panel does not, it will default to expanded and re-expand after a page refresh.
h3. Environment

Jira 8.0.+
 Any compatible Big Picture Plugin
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Evaluate BigPicture / BigGantt program
 # Click on "Develop a project plan" task key
 # Collapse WBS widget by button marked on screenshot
 # Refresh browser page

!bigpicture.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected result:

WBS widget collapse is saved after browser refresh
h3. Actual result:

WBS widget collapse is NOT saved after browser refresh

Notes:
 Nothing has changed on the _ppm.wbs.issue.details.panel.bigpicture_ through the versions.
h3. Workaround

Set the panel to default to collapsed using this script (add it at the announcement banner):
{code:java}
<script type="text/javascript">
setTimeout(function() {
$('div[id^="ppm"].module.toggle-wrap').attr("class","module toggle-wrap collapsed");
});
</script>{code}
This way you can just have it stay collapsed until a user needs it.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
No post-commit webhooks added to Bitbucket Cloud repositories after adding DVCS account to Jira as described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-server-applications-814208991.html#ConnectBitbucketCloudtoJiraSoftwareServer-DVCSConnectionnotes
bq. When you link an account using the DVCS Connector, the connector adds a post-commit web hook to all the repositories owned by the account in Bitbucket Cloud. When a commit happens, the web hook passes commit information to the DVCS Connector for processing.

h3. Environment
* Jira Server 8.3, 8.0.2, 7.10 where tested, but probably all Jira Server is affected.
* DVCS connector plugin v5.2.5, 5.1.3, 4.3.6 (latest compatible for Jira 7.x) all affected.
* Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add a DVCS account owning some repositories in BBC to Jira following [Connect Bitbucket Cloud to Jira Software Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-server-applications-814208991.html]

h3. Expected Results
Under Repository > Settings > Webhooks, there should be post-commit and pull-request webhook configurations added automatically with Jira endpoints, for each of the repositories owned by the DVCS account.

h3. Actual Results
* No webhooks to be seen under the DVCS account's repositories. However, POST and Pull Request POST Services (which are now deprecated in favor of Webhooks) are duly created under Repository > Settings > Services
* The implication of this is that changes to Bitbucket Cloud don't get pushed to Jira immediately, leading to delayed updates to Jira's development panel only after the scheduled sync job pulls data from Bitbucket cloud.

h3. Notes
* Tested this with a Jira instance that wasn't accessible via the internet (not accessible from BBC), so not sure it's a factor. However, this didn't prevent the services from being created in BBC.
* Considering the wide variety of Jira and DVCS add-on versions affected, this may well be a BBC bug.

h3. Workaround
Manually creating the webhooks work, although you may hit into a bug with post-commit webhooks [JSWSERVER\-16054: JIRA DVCS fails to update Commits sent by Bitbucket Cloud Webhooks|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16054].
fields.summary: No post-commit webhooks added to Bitbucket Cloud after adding DVCS account to Jira

fields.description:
*Problem:*
As a user, I would like the activity tab to describe the issue description clearly so that I don't confuse it with a comment when clicking on the read-more link.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1. Create a task.
2. Add the description (10-20) lines
3. Add a comment (10-20) lines
4. Click at the "Activity" tab
We will see:
a. Part of the comment added on 3. inside a blue box with the link << read more >>
b. The description of the new task created on 2. with the link << read more >>

5. Click at the <<read more>> on a: The tool will change the focus to the comment tab and show the full comment added on 3. 

6. Click at the <<read more>> on b.

*Expected behavior (by design of the product):*
It will go to the top of the task, showing the description of the task, where you can read all the lines of the description.

*Customer expectation:*
The Customer was expecting to see the same behavior observed on 5. However, as it was a description, the tool just refreshed the page, positioning at the top.

This confusion could be avoided if the description was clearly identified, for instance, starting the window with a label like:
"Description:"  <text of the description> <read-more link>

h3. Problem Definition
As [per this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/configuring-filters-938845268.html#Configuringfilters-(Kanbanonly)Hidingcompletedissues], the description of the function mentions that the function applies to issues in the 'Done' column, which should be the last column. In reality, the affecting factor would be the 'Status Category'. Regardless of the Column, the issues affected by the function would be dependent on the 'Status Category' set.

This causes some confusion in understanding the expected behavior. Also, there are some use cases where the Status with 'Done' Status Category would not be in the last Column, yet the issues would be hidden.

h3. Suggested Solution
The 'Hide completed issues older than' function should only apply to the last 'Column'. Or have an additional configuration to set which Status would actually be affected by the 'Hide completed issues older than' function.

h3. Workaround 
If the Status is in any Columns other than the last column, set the Status Category to 'In Progress'.
fields.summary: The 'Hide completed issues older than' function for Kanban Boards should be configured to only be applied to issues in the last Column (Done Column)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
bq. Unable to retrieve commit information

The above error is seen when viewing the commits information by clicking "Commits" link in Issue's Development Panel. 

h3. Environment
* 100+ commits in an issue
* DVCS integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup DVCS integration
# Commit 100 to a single Jira issue
# Open the same issue on two browsers, login as two different users
# userA click on "commits" then while it loads, have userB to click on "commits"


h3. Expected Results
The commits information loaded and rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2019-08-27 08:19:31,087 devstatus.dvcs.githube:thread-1234 ERROR xxxxx 499x10442828x9 xxxxx 128.161.38.16 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/detail [c.a.j.p.devstatus.provider.LoggingDecorator] Call 'repository details for [TEST-123]' has thrown an exception
java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException: Task com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFutureTask@49e1f380 rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@58ffde96[Running, pool size = 20, active threads = 20, queued tasks = 0, completed tasks = 150373]
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$AbortPolicy.rejectedExecution(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:2047)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.reject(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:823)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.execute(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1369)
at com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors$ListeningDecorator.execute(MoreExecutors.java:550)
at java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService.invokeAll(AbstractExecutorService.java:277)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.DrainableListeningExecutorServiceImpl.invokeAll(DrainableListeningExecutorServiceImpl.java:95)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.dvcs.ChangesetDetailsFetcher.getChangesetsWithFileDetails(ChangesetDetailsFetcher.java:80)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.dvcs.DvcsCommitDetailHelper.getCommitInfoMappedByRepository(DvcsCommitDetailHelper.java:78)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.source.dvcs.DvcsDataProvider.lambda$getDetailDataFutureFor$0(DvcsDataProvider.java:160)
at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.provider.LoggingDecorator.call(LoggingDecorator.java:56)
at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* When viewing the commits information, 1 DVCS thread is responsible to retrieve 1 commit. In most cases, the retrieval is quick enough that the same thread can be re-used.
* The error is due to insufficient available threads when requested by the DVCS plugin. In this scenario, it uses all 20 of the default threads at a time and when trying to request for another failed.

h3. Workaround
Increase the default DVCS threads 
# Edit {{jira-config.properties}}
# Add the following property respective to the integration tools
{code}
// Bitbucket Cloud
jira.devstatus.dvcs.bitbucket.max.threads = 40
// Github Enterprise
jira.devstatus.dvcs.githube.max.threads = 40
// Github 
jira.devstatus.dvcs.github.max.threads = 40
{code}
# Restarts Jira
fields.summary: Intermittent Failure to View Commit in Issue's Development Panel via DVCS

fields.description:
This is a request to improve the documentation on Sprint Reports (all-versions):
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/sprint-report-938845689.html]

 

On _Understanding the Sprint Report_, we say
{quote} * The Sprint Report is board-specific – that is, it will only include issues that match your board's saved filter.
 * The Sprint Report includes only issues that were completed while the sprint was in progress.{quote}
 

The suggested improvement is to address the unmapped statuses since they won't appear in the Reports — even if the issue is resolved and still linked to the Sprint.

Also, on the "Issues Removed From Sprint" section, the issues on unmapped statuses will be listed with the last mapped status they had on the board — not so intuitive, perhaps. So an issue transitioned from "Resolved" (mapped status) to "Done" (unmapped status) will be listed as "Completed" on the Sprint Report. Attachments illustrate this scenario.

Just a suggestion below, with updates *in bold*:
 * The Sprint Report is board-specific – that is, it will only include issues that match your board's saved filter *and columns.*
 * *Issues transitioned to unmapped statuses on the board are considered dropped from the Sprint by the Sprint Reports. They will show up on "Issues Removed from Sprint" with their last mapped status on the board.*
 * ...

  

Customers have been reaching out to Atlassian Support and the Community since early versions of GreenHopper (e.g. [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Sprint-Report-Issues-Not-Complete/qaq-p/439055] and [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Sprint-Report-shows-resolved-issues-as-non-completed/qaq-p/235549]). Sprint Reports are working as expected and it seems we're really just short on assertively addressing the subject in the Docs.
fields.summary: Improve Agile Reports documentation on unmapped statuses

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The problem is tricky and manifests in quite a specific setup only. Here's a summary:
 * In NTFS there’s ADS (Alternate Data Streams) mechanism that allows storing additional meta-data with files
 * The name of a stream is <original_file_name>:<stream_name>, e.g. {{foo.jar:Zone.Identifier}} is a stream named {{Zone.Identifier}} appended to \{{foo.jar }}file
 * When one unpacks content of a ZIP file downloaded from the Internet via IE, Windows attaches “Zone.Identifier” stream to _every_ extracted file; the stream stores info on original archive it comes from and the fact it was downloaded from the web. This is to show “this file was downloaded from the internet” warnings
 * When a file is copied, it’s copied along with all the streams
 * The streams are not (by default?) listed with original files. This is however not true when a *directory is mounted via NFS*, in which case they’re listed just like regular files
 * *Jira, when upgrading, copies plugin files* from it’s installation directory to shared home
 * The result is that *if shared home is mounted via NFS*, Jira plugin system that lists {{installed-plugins}} directory, finds not only original files, but also their additional streams and tries to load them, which causes exceptions like: {{The artifact URI [file:////10.116.134.232/mnt/home/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-software-language-pack-en_US-7.6.15.v20190827165849.jar:Zone.Identifier|file:///10.116.134.232/mnt/home/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-software-language-pack-en_US-7.6.15.v20190827165849.jar:Zone.Identifier] is not a valid plugin artifact}}

 
h3. Example

Here's a real-life example. The initial state is Jira 8.3.2 DC installed on Windows box with shared home mounted via NFS. Adding {{/r}} switch to {{dir}} command causes it to show streams along with regular files and we can see there are none yet:
{code:java}

h3. Environment
 * Jira DC running on Windows
 * Shared home mounted via NFS
 * Jira binaries downloaded from Internet via IE
 * Most probably all the Jira versions are affected, although the problem has been reproduced on Jira 7.6.15 and 8.3.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Jira DC installation on Windows with shared home mounted via NFS
 # Download a ZIP with newer Jira version; unpack the archive  
 # Run Jira from the new location so that it upgrades

h3. Expected Results

Jira runs with no exceptions.
h3. Actual Results

Jira runs, all the necessary plugins are loaded, but it tries to load {{*.jar:Zone.Identifier}} as well, which causes exceptions to be thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2019-09-03 07:59:29,559 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [c.a.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] Unable to deploy plugin 'null' from 'Unit: \\10.116.134.172\mnt\home\plugins\installed-plugins\jira-software-plugin-8.3.3.jar:Zone.Identifier (1567497535639)'.
2019-09-03 07:59:29,559 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [c.a.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader] Because of the following exception:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The artifact URI file:////10.116.134.172/mnt/home/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-software-plugin-8.3.3.jar:Zone.Identifier is not a valid plugin artifact
        at com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginArtifactFactory.create(DefaultPluginArtifactFactory.java:59)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.deployPluginFromUnit(ScanningPluginLoader.java:142)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(ScanningPluginLoader.java:90)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.PermissionCheckingPluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(PermissionCheckingPluginLoader.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.lambda$earlyStartup$3(DefaultPluginManager.java:539)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginTransactionContext.wrap(PluginTransactionContext.java:63)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.earlyStartup(DefaultPluginManager.java:523)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraPluginManager.earlyStartup(JiraPluginManager.java:119)
        at com.atlassian.jira.component.pico.ComponentManager$PluginSystem.earlyStartup(ComponentManager.java:669)
        at com.atlassian.jira.component.pico.ComponentManager.earlyStartPluginSystem(ComponentManager.java:238)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.PluginSystemLauncher.start(PluginSystemLauncher.java:45)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postDbLaunch$2(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:145)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:301)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseActivated(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:196)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:137)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$start$0(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:104)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:31)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:102)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuff(LauncherContextListener.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuffInBackground(LauncherContextListener.java:139)
        at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.contextInitialized(LauncherContextListener.java:101)
        ... 5 filtered
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
as well as those files being listed in UPM as disabled due to Jira being unable to correctly load them.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.

 
h3. Notes

This problem might be reduced to an issue of plugin system trying to load non-JAR/OBR files.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Once issues are moved to unmapped statuses on the board, and they are assigned to a New Sprint once the current sprint ends, the reports for New Sprint do not behave consistently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

   # Add a status to the default workflow called "Cancelled"
   # add a post function to set the resolution to "Won't do"
   # on the scrum board make sure "Cancelled" is in the "unmapped statuses column
   # Start a sprint (let's assume you have two issues in it ISSUE-1 and ISSUE-2)
   # Mark ISSUE-1 as Cancelled (obviously by a method other than drag and drop
   # See how it is no longer visible on the board
   # Check the sprint report for this sprint, see how it lists ISSUE-1 as "removed from sprint"
   # Now close the sprint. It will tell you that 2 issues were incomplete (I would expect to see 1)
   # Choose to move the incomplete issues to a new sprint.
   # See how there is only 1 issue showing in the backlog for the sprint.
   # Look at ISSUE-1, see how it says it's in the new future sprint.
   # Start the new sprint.
   # See how the sprint report for the new sprint does not include ISSUE-1 in the list of issues added to the sprint.
   # Check the Burndown Chart for the new sprint, ISSUE-1 is showing there.

h3. Expected Results

Either the unmapped issue would be considered added/not added to the sprint by both reports.

h3. Actual Results
# For the previous sprint:
#* Burndown will show ISSUE-1 as issue completed
#* Sprint report will show ISSUE-1 as removed from sprint
# For current/next sprint
#* The issue is considered to have been added to the sprint by the Burndown Chart.
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-02 at 11.20.34.png|thumbnail! 
#* The issue is considered to not have been added to the sprint by the Sprint Report.
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-02 at 12.23.36.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Mapping the statuses to a column (if the status is "Cancelled", map the status to the "Done" column).
fields.summary: Reports are inconsistent for issues on unmapped statuses.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, issues can only be included in completed Sprints should the Status is configured in the last Column (in the Board's Column Management page):
 !ColMan.png|thumbnail! 
Some business requirements may not require the Sub-tasks to have the completed Status in the last Column. This would result in preventing the Sub-task along with the Parent Issue to be included in the completed sprint.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the configuration to set separate completed statuses for Parent Issue and Sub-task

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Allow configurable separate completed/done Status for Parent Issues and Sub-tasks in order to complete Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Active Sprints can load slower than the Backlog.
Example, clicking on the "Quick Filter" will reload the entire Active Sprints data. This can take longer for a complex Sprint with lots of issues.

We have improved how Backlog is loaded in JSWSERVER-9920 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Reduce the number of JQL queries needed to run
* Load only the necessary data (minus the Epic and Version data)
 
h5. Notes
In 8.3.0, click on "Quick filter" action show

With {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers}} DEBUG

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Development info on issue cards on agile board introduced in 8.1.x raises error if the login user doesn't have "View Development Tools" permission.

This is apparently because of JSWSERVER-14858. Internally the board is sending requests to {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=undefined}} ending up with 400 bad request.

h3. Environment

* Jira Software 8.2 environment with dev-tools integration
* Logged in with any user that doesn't have "View Development Tools" permission.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a freshly installed jira Software 8.2 instance, create an Agile Board (Kanban or Scrum doesn't matter)
 # Configure the card to display development information based on 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-1-x-release-notes-966669112.html#JiraSoftware8.1.xreleasenotes-devinfo
 # Populate the Agile project with a few issues
# Login the user  that doesn't have "View Development Tools" permission as described above.
 
h3. Expected Results

Development information isn't present.
 
h3. Actual Results

The card raises error. "An error occurred whilst rendering this message....."
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-02 at 15.05.14.png|thumbnail! 
Internally the board raises following error for the request to {{/rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary?issueId=undefined}} 
{code:xml}
{"errorMessages":["An invalid ID was provided: 'undefined'"],"errors":{}}
{code}


h3. Workaround
Add "View Development Tools" permission to the user.
fields.summary: Development info on issue cards raises error if the login user doesn't have "View Development Tools" permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The DVCS synchronization can take a long time for a repository to complete. Especially when a Full sync is triggered over Soft sync. The sync activity is running in the back-end limited by the number of threads and database activity, which in turn takes longer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option to perform "Full lock repository sync" on one node of the cluster. The idea is to shorten the time to complete the full sync for DVCS plugin, similar to the "Full lock re-indexing" option.
 
h3. Workaround 
_none_
fields.summary: As an Admin, would like option to lock full sync selected DVCS repository

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be helpful if on the issue type scheme an effective date range could be configured for issue types such that for projects where that issue type scheme is used, certain issue types can only be selected by users during the configured date interval.

This would have the effect of being able to obsolete an issue type within a project(s) without changing existing tickets.

Use Case: Our company decided to change the way they were handling certain returns issues. The old way was valid but less efficient and caused occasional confusion for the warehouse associates. The new way is more uniform, streamlined, and contains fewer exceptions. Jira tickets for investigation into the cause of each instance are handled very differently and for a while during implementation both processes will exist. The old process will go away after a while so users should no longer be allowed to create those tickets after that point.
fields.summary: Add Effective Date Range to Issue Type in Issue Type Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Jira 8.2.4, the Agile Wallboard Gadget flashes unexpectedly when the board utilizes "Queries" as card colour configuration.

The problem is not reproducible on Jira 7.9.0.

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.2.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the Agile Wallboard Gadget to be based on a board.
# Go to the board configuration, and configure card color.
#* User "Queries" as the card color configuration.
# Return to Agile Wallboard Gadget.

h3. Expected Results
* Agile Wallboard Gadget would show correct card color based on Queries used.

h3. Actual Results
* Agile Wallboard Gadget is flashing.  [^GadgetFlashing.webm] 

h3. Notes
* Issue is not reproducible on Jira 7.9.0  [^KanbanNotFlashing.webm] 


h3. Workaround
No workaround known so far.
fields.summary: The Agile Wallboard Gadget flashes unexpectedly when the board utilizes "Queries" as card colour configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue export to XML does not include the same data as export to CSV (All fields) – specifically the _Work Log_ description is not exported.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log work on an issue.
 # Add a Work Description.
 # Export issues that contain {{worklogComment}}.

h3. Expected Results

XML export includes the issue's Log Work Description.
h3. Actual Results

XML export does not contain Log Work Description.
h3. Workaround

Export → CSV (All fields) contains the Log Work Description – use this export if the field data is required.
fields.summary: XML Export does not include Log Work comments

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on the Boards link in the top navigation bar is showing a section of 'Recent Boards'.  In Jira Software 8.1.2 and higher (possibly other versions), it appears that this recent board list is no longer showing unique results to each user, but instead it looks like this resource is sharing the recent boards of other JSW users (provided that your account also has access to that same board).

h3. Environment
Tested in 8.1.2, 8.2.3 and found this unexpected functionality happens.

However when trying to replicate in 7.13.1, and 8.0.2, this behavior does not happen. In these older versions each user appears to have their own recent boards values that are only generated by the boards they view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board (AAA project key for this example)
# Create a second Jira software licensed user
# Login as the newly created 2nd user, and then create a new board with board name (TEST)
# In a new browser (incognito) login as user 1 again, then visit the Boards -> recent boards


h3. Expected Results
If user #1 has not recently been to board TEST, they should not see it in the recent list

h3. Actual Results
User #1 sees TEST board in the recent boards list


h3. Notes
This does not appear to leak names of ALL boards exactly.  Your user account can still only see in the recent boards entries that your account actually has permissions to see.  However this recent board should be bound to the currently logged in user and that is not what appears to be happening right now.
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-28 at 5.07.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 
^ shows recent boards of other users, not the current user right now


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: View recent boards shows boards that all users have viewed instead of board your account viewed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Natively, Jira counts with a great and very convenient feature: [global reflexive transitions|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/How-to-get-to-the-next-level-in-workflow-design/ba-p/1135968].

However, that feature is really difficult to discover, as it currently requires to:
 # Enter the workflow editor in diagram mode.
 # Click on the _Add transition_ button (please, note that the most popular method for adding transitions is drag&drop on status nodes).
 # Select _Any status_ in the _From status_ dropdown field.
 # Select _Itself_ in the _To status_ dropdown field.
 # Add a Name & click on the Save button.

Counting with more intuitive ways through the UI for creating this kind of transition would be desirable.

Maybe it would be a good idea prompting a dialog on creating a looping transition (a transition from a status to itself). The dialog could show a concise text and a couple of buttons:
 * *Text*: Looping transitions are frequently useful from other statuses too. Would you like to create a global looping transition?
 * *Button 1*: Make global
 * *Button 2*: No, thanks

Additionally, a _Read more_ or (?) icon would ideally link to a documentation page which explained the advantages of using global looping transitions.
fields.summary: UX: Facilitate natural discovery of global looping transitions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When completing a sprint in Jira not all incomplete issues are moved to the selected sprint.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with two boards
# Set one of the boards to only one issue type (e.g. Bug)
# Create two sprints and add one issue of each type to each sprint
# Start the sprint
# On the board with only one issue type, complete the sprint and select to move all issues to the second sprint.

See [^complete_sprint.mov]

h3. Expected Results
* All issues in that sprint would be migrated to the new Sprint
* Or Jira would show a message stating that X issues would not be moved as they are not part in the board.

h3. Actual Results
Jira shows:
{panel}
*X* issues were incomplete
Select where all the incomplete issues should be moved:
{panel}
but only moves the sub-set of issues that are present in the board.

h3. Workaround
* Manually bulk-edit the issues after completing the sprint.
* Or have a board with all issues in the sprint included, and complete the sprint from this board.
fields.summary: Completing a sprint only moves incomplete issues to next sprint if the issue is in the board

fields.description:
The [OAuth page|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/oauth/] on developer.atlassian.com shows how to authenticate clients against the Jira REST API using OAuth version 1.0a.

In the documentation though we state:
bq.  You must pass the data in the header instead, for example, {{Authorization: Bearer \{access_token\}}}.

However, this is only available for OAuth 2.0 and not 1.0 which causes confusion on how to authenticate. We should remove this part from the documentation.
fields.summary: Update the OAuth documentation

fields.description:
I am a project manager and routinely need to view/track cases that are in other teams queues, but when trying to add this information to our kanban board with "currentuser()" JQL, all of the versions for these other projects show up in the versions panel of the backlog, either breaking the panel, or overpopulating it with versions I am unconcerned with. 

I have tried using a posted workaround, but it does not constrain the versions in the panel:

project = projA OR (reporter = currentUser() OR assignee = currentUser() ) AND (fixVersion not in unreleasedVersions(projB, projC, projD) OR fixVersion is EMPTY) AND (resolved >= -7d OR resolved is EMPTY) ORDER BY Rank ASC

It would be very helpful to be able to include a versions filter in the board configuration screen

!image-2019-08-23-07-38-56-650.png!
fields.summary: Create native Filter options for Version on Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Defining the problem:*
  1. It is not obvious to the user that entering multiple words in the Quick Search will not find the issue if each word is in a different standard text field. This is also an issue if one word is in a standard text field and the other is in a custom text field. The only reference to this behavior I saw is the blue information box in the NOT section of this page:
 
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/search-syntax-for-text-fields-861257223.html#Searchsyntaxfortextfields-NOT]
 
  2. In order to search for multiple words, each of which can appear individually in separate standard (or custom) text fields, users must write JQL. There should be an easier way to tell the system to search for multiple words and include JIRAs where the words appear in separate text fields.
 
*Suggested solution:*
  If a user enters multiple words in the Quick Search, there should be a popup message (like the Smart Search popup) or an info box stating "Only showing JIRAs for which all words appear in the same text field (all words appear in the Summary, or all words appear in the Comments, etc). To search for JIRAs without this restriction, click here". Clicking the link should change the JQL from:
 
    text ~ "word1 word2 [... wordN]"
    
    To:
    
    text ~ "word1" AND text ~ "word2" ... AND text ~ "wordN"
 
Additionally, there should be more robust options for doing a text search on the JIRA Search page. I would suggest there should be a "Text Search" button next to the Basic/Advanced link. This should show options (maybe right on the page, maybe via a popup, or maybe on a separate page altogether) to allow users to do a text search exactly the way they want, without having to enter it in the quick search and then click the link from the popup/info box I am suggesting. And also without having to type in all the JQL themselves. These options should allow users to enter multiple words and phrases, along with AND and OR options, including an option to turn on and off the "all words and phrases must appear in the same text field" functionality.
 
 I feel that both the proposed popup/info box for the Quick Search, as well as the suggested "Text Search" button should be implemented. The Quick Search popup will inform users of how the Quick Search handles multiple words. And the "Text Search" button will provide a robust way to enter text search criteria so users can go directly there if they know the Quick Search won't do what they need.
fields.summary: Quicksearch : Add options to make text search parse all relevant fields for individual terms, instead of all terms that appear in one field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Benutzer: „“ is displayed instead of the added username in Edit Current Filter page for Deutsch language users.
h3. Environment

Linux, Windows

Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Jira software panel as Deutsch (Deutschland) language user.
 # Go to "Vorgänge"(Issues) -> "Filter verwalten" (Manage Filters) -> click "gear icon" -> Click "Bearbeiten" (Edit) -> Under section "Editoren hinzufügen" (Add Editors) -> Select "Benutzer" (user) -> search for any user -> Click +
(or)
Go to Boards -> "Alle Boards anzeigen" -> click "..." -> "Konfigurieren" (Configure) -> click "Freigabeberechtigungen für Filter bearbeiten" (Edit Filter Shares) -> Under section "Editoren hinzufügen" -> Select "Benutzer" (user) -> search for any user -> Click +

h3. Expected Results

Actual Username should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Benutzer: „“
h3. Workaround

1. Move the mouse cursor over Benutzer: „“ to view the added username.
2. username will be displayed after clicking Save.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Shared Dashboard Filter with viewer option "Project -> All" can be viewed by other project users.

 


Environment

Linux, Windows.

Jira Software v7.12.3, v8.3.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two groups with different set of users(Example: Group1[user1,user2], Group2[test1,test2])
 # Create a project permission scheme with Group1,Group2 containing grant permission for all Project Permission(Browse Projects), Issue Permissions.
 # Create two projects (Example: Project1, Project2) and assign the same project permission.
 # Login to Jira portal as user1 and create shared filter with following permission.
Manage Filters -> Filter1 -> Add Viewer -> Project -> Project1 -> All -> Add
 # Login to Jira portal as test1 user and click on Issues -> Manage Filters. Shared filter of user1 will be displayed under Popular.

h3. Expected Results

Only users within Group1 (User1, User2) should be able to view the shared filter.
h3. Actual Results

Users on both group Group1, Group2 can view the shared filter restricted to specific Project.

 
h3. Workaround

1.Create role and assign users to specific role.

2.Set the filter share permission limited to project role.

Manage Filters -> Filter1 -> Add Viewer -> Project -> Project1 ->Role1 -> Add
fields.summary: Project specific Shared Filter can be viewed by other Project Users

Linking a Service Desk project to a kanban board seems to error out when leaving a comment. However, the comment does indeed get added to the issue.

fields.description: At times when a plugin providing a gadget for a dashboard is being upgraded, accessing the gadget in the dashboard, generates wrong or incomplete specs. Since we have the cache for gadget specs set as expireAfterAccess(24, HOURS), the incomplete specs cached, never expire in a environment with large number of users who access it frequently. This results in corrupt content being shown in the dashboard until a restart. The suggestion is to provide a means to expire the cache at a shorter interval for gadget specs so that such scenarios can be avoided.
fields.summary: cache expiration time for gadget specs should be shorter to avoid corrupt dashboard
